content.question: Let h be the function given by h(x) = f(x) - g(x). Find the absolute minimum value of h(x) on the closed interval <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math>, and find the absolute maximum of h(x) on the closed interval <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math>. Show the analysis that leads to your answers.

frqParts.text: Let h be the function given by h(x) = f(x) - g(x). Find the absolute minimum value of h(x) on the closed interval <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math>, and find the absolute maximum of h(x) on the closed interval <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math>. Show the analysis that leads to your answers.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
